intro: Chondrilla filifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as cotton and hibiscus. Chondrilla filifolia is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
